snippet: During most of Derek Jeter’s career, he and the Yankees used the Orioles as their personal American League doormat. But that did not stop the crowd in Baltimore from cheering him on Friday night.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column observes that during most of Derek Jeter’s career, he and the New York Yankees used the Baltimore Orioles as their personal American League doormat; notes that regardless, crowd jumped to its feet and cheered him in one of his final appearances at the plate.
lead_paragraph: During most of Derek Jeter’s career, he and the Yankees used the Orioles as their personal American League doormat. But that did not stop the crowd in Baltimore from cheering him on Friday night.

headline.seo: Orioles Fans Overlook Rivalry to Honor Derek Jeter
headline.main: That Applause at Camden Yards? It’s for the Thorn in Baltimore’s Side
headline.print_headline: That Applause in Baltimore? It’s for the Thorn in the Orioles’ Side
